Content: Meraviglia... si estende oltre la città del Vaticano, ed è la metà del principato di Monaco come km².. assolutamente da visitare, soprattutto per il museo di armi antiche, dei gioielli e delle reliquie dell'islam(ci sono pure il bastone di Mosè e i peli della barca di Maometto)

Muita, muita gente. Desisti de entrar na sala das joias, fila de 40 min. O local não é bem organizado em termos de informações.  Não perca sei tempo na fila do áudio guide. Não vale a pena, muito ruim de operar e acrescenta pouco.
Топкапы конечно, бесподобен во всей красе. Прекрасная архитектура, мусульманского стиля, очень красивая. Музей, много великолепных экспонатов. Очереди большие, но двигались быстро.
מומלץ לביקור ולקנות כרטיסים לכול הכניסות.

Make sure you allow at least three or four hours to explore Topkapi Palace and its courtyards. There are many exhibits in the   various palace rooms from exquisite jewels to ancient swords, 15th century bows with quivers of arrows and an excellent exhibition of lavish clothing covering hundreds of years. One thing to watch out for is the free audio guide, yes it is free but you have to deposit either your passport or £100 cash or equivalent in other currencies so be prepared!

На мой взгляд по настоящему оценят этот дворец только фанаты сериала "Великолепный век" и религиозные люди. Огромные толпы народа, куча времени в очередях, если сравнивать с русскими дворцами - смотреть особо нечего.

I ordered Turkish tea and cake at a cafe located on the beach to the right of Topkapi Palace, and the lemon cheesecake was truly delicious.The atmosphere around the cafe near the Bosphorus Strait was free and cool.However, when paying, I don't know if it was a mistake, but the staff asked me to add 10 lira.  You need to check in detail.
Superbe palais, à visiter absolument

This place is huge. Historical building still maintained well. Pleasantly surprised by the Islamic history. Also you need at least half a day to visit. Don’t bother with the audio sound guide you can barely hear the device.

Zaten gününüzün tamamını ayırsanız belki hepsini gezebilirsiniz. Bu arada girişi müzekart kullanarak yapabilirsiniz fakat bazı alanlar ekstra ücretli.

It’s a beautiful place. Most beautiful museum I been to. I went there though during early May it was really cold still and there’s times lots of walking. Wear the best shoes.

Way too expensive for what it offers.  Also stroller unfriendly. Most of the rooms you can't enter with the stroller so you must leave it outside, the rest of the rooms have stairs.  They give guides device without headsets. Toilets dirty and smelly. If you have seen Abu Dhabi or other palaces this is a waste of time and money.
J'adore

The territory is big, try allocate the whole day for visiting especial of you're planning to include Harem and St. Irene's church. Beautiful enough.Great collection of pieces of everyday life of sultans.
Totally worth visiting

World wide famous place. How can it not be 5 stars.   Chilly, rainy day, 35$ pp admission, still crowded, long lines outside and inside.Every nationality in the world is here.  That is amazing as well as the site.All about the power and wealth of the Ottoman Empire.  And wow, did they have a lot of power.  It's on display here.  The gold, jewels, opulence, marble, mosaics, exotic fabrics, weapons,  Muslim artifacts (the prophets footprint, Davids sword).  Amazing.   Of and the human abuse... amazing, too.  Slaves,  sacrifices, torture, concubines.  It was all here.   At one time.  A long time ago.Generally, it is a very well organized and secure place.   Lots of workers, in uniform, some in tie and jacket, folks sweeping cleaning.   All willing to answer questions, smile. Turkish people look after their history and do it well.Complaints?  The WCs need upgrades. The line, especially women, is too long, the facility dirty and cramped.   A world-famous site, come on,  this is not the memory you want folks to leave with.Cafe is too small, not nearly enough seats.   The signage is not good.  The maps are worn out.  The legend items on the map aren't on the map.  Signs with arrows, please!  There are many buildings, and too much time was wasted trying to find them.   Rest areas: need more benches.Plan on 2-5 hours.   There's that much stuff to see.  Also, great swarms of cruise boat tourists and school kids slow things down.   Take your time and have patience, it's going to take all day anyway.Is it worth 35$ pp? Given the long lines (30 minutes, October, Monday, 10am) to get they long lines while inside to get into buildings,  most would say yes.  The lines move well, so they are tolerable.There is no need to buy tickets ahead.   You will still wait in line to get in the gate and to get into the popular buildings (palace, religious artifacts).
lengkap.. sejuk, di sekitarnya banyak burung gagak dan burung camar

If you have been to Palaces or Castles in France/Germany or in Rajasthan, India, this one is rather unspectacular and costs quite a lot in comparison (32-33€ in October 2023).The Harem is more interesting than rest of the palace but you need to buy the Palace tickets to be able to go to the Harem.The museums are alright, like any other Palace or Castle museums. You look at first few items carefully and for the rest of the museum, you would just walk through.Entry: We reached there around 9:30 on a Monday, there was almost no queue for buying the tickets and we could enter the palace directly.There are many toilets in different parts of the palace and a small cafe.
Haftaiçi olmasına rağmen çok kalabalıktı. Muzekart geçerli. Ama her bölümü müze kart plusla gezemiyorsunuz. Silahlar bölümüne bayıldım.

Fortaleza otomana en el centro de Estambul. Es una delicia dar un paseo por dentro, visitando los diferentes edificios que lo componen, y las vistas al Marmara.Pero el precio altísimo, casi 35€ por persona cuando hemos ido nosotros. Y mucha cola para entrar, para coger la audioguia, y para entrar en la sala del tesoro.Merece la pena entrar solo si tienes mucho tiempo disponible.
Les comparto q es un lugar de mucha historia si tienen la oportunidad de visitar Estambul lo recomiendo al 100 %
It should definitely be visited to get to know the Ottoman Empire and learn about its sensitivity to human and living life.A uniquely beautiful place for children to get to know the past.

The Topkapi Palace is one of the largest surviving places and was built between 1460 and 1478 under the orders of Sultan Mehmed II a few years after he conquered Constantinople. The palace served as the home of the Ottoman Sultans for almost four centuries.Know Before You Visit Topkapi Palace :----------------------------------------Visitors will need to wear appropriate clothing that covers their shoulders and knees while visiting Topkapi Palace. Shorts, skirts, sleeveless, or strapless clothing is not allowed within the premises of the Sacred Relics department.Tickets:--------I would recommend that you pre-purchase your tickets and skip the line tour. Enjoy a guided tour inside the Topkapi Palace and see the four courtyard museum including the Audience Hall, High Court, Historical Kitchens, and The Treasury.

Dibangun pada tahun 1453 oleh Sultan Mehmed II setelah menaklukan Bizantium Konstantinopel dari Kekaisaran Romawi, Istana ini terdiri dari empat lapangan besar dan ratusan bangunan di dalamnya.Tempat ini selain menjadi rumah tinggal Sultan dan keluarganya juga merupakan pusat pemerintahan puluhan Sultan setelahnya. Konon ribuan orang menempati Istana ini, bahkan dapurnya saja terdapat 800 koki yang setiap harinya menyiapkan 4.000 porsi makanan untuk orang dalam Istana maupun fakir miskin yang ada di Istanbul.Pintu masuk Istana seluas 700.000 M2 ini sejatinya adalah pintu masuk benteng. Setelah melewati pemeriksaan kita disambut lapangan yang luas dan bangunan di kanan kirinya. Ada gedung pertemuan pemerintahan, rumah anak istri dan kerabat istana, dapur umum, masjid, madrasah, dll. Bangunan satu sama lain dipisahkan oleh taman yang kalau musim semi pasti penuh dengan aneka warna bunga yang mempesona.Yang menarik di sini adalah salah satu bangunan musium tempat penyimpanan barang-barang bersejarah yang ada di pavilliun deretan bangunan sebelah kiri. Ya karena di sini tersimpan barang peninggalan Nabi Muhammad SAW seperti foot print, pedang, janggut, gigi (yang tanggal saat perang Uhud), busur panah, stempel, dll. Selain itu juga ada pedang milik keempat sahabat nabi, jubah Fatimah, kunci Ka'bah, cover Hajar Aswad, tangan nabi Yahya, sorban Nabi Ibrahim, tongkat Nabi Musa, dll.Ayat suci Al Qur'an berkumandang selama kita keliling dalam musium ini. Konon dahulu di ruangan itu ada Qari yang membaca Alqur'an secara bergantian selama 24 jam tanpa henti. Sayangnya kita tidak boleh memotret di ruangan ini.  Tapi tak apa, melihat peninggalannya saja hati ini sudah cukup meleleh dibuatnya.Di bagian belakang bisa kita temui taman dan tempat bersantai Sultan dan keluarganya dengan view Selat Bosphorus. Cantik sekali.

Bonjour a tous. A voir absolument.  Vous n êtes pas obligé de prendre la visite du harem ( facultatif ) billet (s) au fond à droite. Allez y le matin pour éviter la foule. Si vous voulez tous voir ( harem ) compris, prévoir la matinée... Passez aussi voir les anciennes cuisines à gauche quand vous avez fini la visite. Vous pourrez achetez des boissons, sandwiches, il y a des toilettes.

A magnificent place to visit, but you have to wear the right shoes. Unfortunately when I came a lot of rooms were closed.
Really good museum. I recommend it to people who are interested in mouslim culture and have a lot of time to explore museum.

Muy interesante.  Se necesita casi tres horas para recorrerlo. Para entrar a un sector, las mujeres deben cubrirse el cabello. Si no tienen el velo, lo prestan en el lugar. Entrada sin harem  unos 25 dólares, con harem unos 8 dólares más.
Assolutamente da vedere a Istanbul. Giardini stupendi, harem bellissimo e molto caratteristico.
Carísimo y sobrevalorado

این کاخ از دوران عثمانی به جا مانده، کاخ خیلی بزرگ هست و برای بازدید از همه ی قسمت هاش حداقل ۵-۴ ساعت باید وقت بگذارید. محیط بسیار تمیز و سرسبزی داره و چند نقطه از اون نمای زیبایی از تنگه بسفر دارد که بسیار زیباست.
A whole lot of history to the place, this is a place to visit for all tourists. The museum houses some old and unique artifacts and provides glimpses of the Ottoman era.
Zelo lepo in vredno ogleda. Umetnine izjemne.

Osmanlının ne kadar lüks içinde yaşadığının resmen  yaşayan bir kanıtı saraya gerçekten büyük bir alana kurulu ve çok büyük içerisinde bir sürü odalar Osmanlı kıyafetlerinden tutun takılar silahlar mutfak gereçleri kutsal emanetler vs. Herşey var giriş diğer müzelerden ziyade 150 tl artı haremi gezmek için 80 tl ödüyorsunuz biz harem için ayrı giriş bileti almadık. Giriş için internet üzerinden veya oradan fiziki olarak müzekart çıkarmanızı tavsiye ederim hem giriş için ücret ödemiyorsunuz hemde beklemiyorsunuz
Merece la pena. Lleva tiempo visitarlo
Very expensive, but so worth it! We loved this palace, gorgeous and unique. You can skip the line if you buy your ticket at the ticket machine. You can spend a whole day there.
Assolutamente da vedere
Me encantó, estuve cinco horas recorriendolo. Impresionante

Ekim ayı olmasına rağmen aşırı kalabalık.  Çok sıra oluyor. Müze kartınız varsa biraz daha avantajlısınız en azından bilet kuyruğuna girmezsiniz. Her yere girişte sıra uzuyor. Özellikle kaşıkçı elması tarafı baya yoğun. Sadece Kutsal emanetler kısmını gezmek bile 40 dkya yakın sürüyor. Salı günü müze tatil dikkat ediniz.
A Place you have to see when you are in Istanbul. Very big and old. Nice Experience
Topkapı sarayı müzesi harem ihtişam tarihi herşey gönlünüzce olsun şiddetle tavsiye ederim

This place was so packed - queue for ticket, then queue for audio guide then queue to get in every single room to see the displays. Like Disneyworld but no thrill once you get to the front of the queue. 950 lira per person to get in was just too much for what was inside, don’t get me wrong there are beautiful historical pieces but the place is too packed to really appreciate it.
Splendido palazzo con esposizione di vestiti gioielli armi e reliquie
Mükemmel
Cool place. You can't get around it in one go. Been there 4-5 timesI recommend it, but only with a museum card. I don’t recommend going to the harem - it’s expensive and there’s nothing to see there

It was an amazing experience and everything was well controlled by management.Tickets prices were 750 and 950 turkish lira with little changes. The sound guide was included in tickets.The place was damn clean and all the heritage sites were maintained properly.Everyone should visit this place, atleast once in a life time.I like the most, where they kept holy relics related to islam.
Все дуже сподобалося.

El Palacio de Topkapi en Turquía es un tesoro histórico que te transportará a la época del Imperio Otomano. Sus impresionantes salas y jardines esconden increíbles historias de sultanes, harenes y tesoros. ¡Una visita imperdible para los amantes de la historia y la arquitectura!
Keşke bu kadar turist yığılması olmasa...
Mi aspettavo di vedere più interni dell'epoca ottomana. Il cortile più bello è il quarto
一定要去一次，很壯觀的古蹟
Histórico y mágico visita obligada en Istambul
word famous meseum what to say about want to go over n again.....
Palácio lindo com um jardim na frente, onde vc pode encontrar lanchonetes, lojas, bancos para sentar
Велколепно!

Bir cok alandan oluşan müzenin gezilecek bölümlerini bir noktadan baslayip kilavuz halinde yapmadiklari için. Rehber esliginde gelmeyen insanlar karisik geziyorlar ve belkide bazi bölümlerini gezmeden çıkıyorlar. İçerde yaklaşık 2 saati bulan bir surede harem bölümü haric vakit harciyorsunuz hafta icide gittim kalabalik hafta sonuda gezdim kalabalık. Hafta ici toplu okul gezilerine denk gelebilrsiniz. Hafta sonu gezmek için her zman daha iyi.
Her Türk evladının hayatında en az birkere gidip görmezi gereken bir müze . İçindeki kutsal emanetler kısmı bizi çok etkiledi . Müze kart ile Harem hariç diğer alanlara üçretsiz girilebiliyor.

A little bit overrated. The place itself has lots of history, but the places inside it end up disappointing considering the mega hype they get on blogs and other places. If you would like to check every inch of the place allow for 4 to 5 hours total. The city views at the end of the tour are worth your 30 minutes.

Чудова архітектура і оздоблення. Аудіо гід дає гарне супроводження, розповідаючи про палац та ключові події, пов'язані з ним. Аудіозаписи не задовгі, приблизно співпадають з часом який потрібен для огляду. Не сподобалось що гарем та більша частина житлових приміщень не мають жодних меблів, бракує фото, тож важко уявити як те все виглядало та для як використовувалось.
Цена за посещение конечно конская. 950 лир за человека, это почти 4000 рублей.
Çok güzel
Muthis gezilmesi gerekir , sadece giristeki ucret yuksek o yetmezmis gibi icerdede ucretlii yerler var

The largest palace in the world! Quite the place to see, the museums to experience (clocks, textiles/clothing of sultans and their kids, armory and weapons, jewels, religious relics - parts of John the Baptist). Amazing viewpoints of the Golden Horn. Entry is 750 lira with an option to pay entry to see the harem section (which is currently under construction - October 2023 - and according to our guide not worth to see in its current state). Do hire a guide to walk you through this vast property to get the most out of it.
Przepiękne miejsce,każdy znajdzie coś dla siebie. Chociaż wszystko co w tym pałacowym kompleksie jest piękne. 😯😯😯😯🤗🤗🤗🤗👍👍👍👍
Kina grandesa a costa del poble

Came here in September with a tour group.Our last stop for the first day in Istanbul.Large place, not enough time to explore.Need a couple of hours to really see all.Also has a great view of Bosphorus straits and both continents.
Beautiful Palace in a beautiful environment.It is worth the visit.

Pe o ploaie torentiala, am vizitat acest locas unde șade sabia lui Stefan Cel Mare! In rest se vede clar opulența in care au trait turcii si sultanii lor, care numai razboaie si nenorociri au adus Europei si nu numai. Parca-l vad prin gradina palatului pe Vlad Țepes cand era tânar, plimbându-se trist.
من اجمل الاماكن التي يجب زيارتها عند السفر الى اسطنبول للاطلاع على اثار السلاطين

Very huge place, it can take whole day ... try to start the visit early as possible 9am, also check before going some times it is closed.Also the queue for the Audio Kit is too long. Ensure to visit Haramlik as well as the different buildings .After finishing if you still have power you can go visit blue Mosque and Aya Sofia and baslic but I doubt you can make it. So I would recommend go and have good lunch near by restaurant or at the bosphoros
Продают билеты, а идёт ремонт и все затянуто плёнкой, и все закрыто. 300 лир билет. Хоть бы во дворик пустили
There is the Staff of Moses, but, I am not really sure for it. It is a beautiful place.
Must visit in Istanbul.. I cannot say in words about beauty and feelings..

Одним словом:впечатляет. Не рекомендую покупать билеты у гидов и всех тех,кто предлагает вход без очереди. Мы купили билеты по 950 лир за человека. В билет входило: посещение дворца Топкапы,посещение Гарема и посещение мечети Святой Ирины. Аудиогид мы не брали. Во первых за ним была бешеная очередь,во вторых,кто брал,сказали что зря взяли. Мы гуляли ,не торопясь обошли всё. Была очередь в сокровищницу,в которой мы простояли 20 минут.И в этой очереди стояли все,включая и группы в сопровождении гидов. Это была единственная очередь,в которой мы стояли.
Indubbiamente interessante. Completamente diversa dalle Reggie delle monarchie Europee
Много история!
Labai gražu ir įdomu . Verta aplankyti.

We visited on Friday. Before noon, It was manageable, but afternoon the crowns were just crazy and queues were everywhere. I do not recommend waiting for the audioguide as the audio is available on-line and they will just hand you a smartphone with the tracks - they will not even give you a headphones. The harem is the most interesting part of the place. Gardens are beautiful and the view from the terraces is also quite good. If you can visit in the morning, I would recommend it.
It was a great tour and had so much fun learning about the history of the palace. The museums inside are packed with old artifacts and the gardens are relaxing and so well-kept.
Muhteşem bir tarih hazinesi
It's pretty
Nice place for picnic

Bundan 7 yıl önce Topkapı sarayını ziyaret etmiştim ve o zamanlar hiç beğenmemiştim. Dekorasyon adına hiçbir şey yoktu. Ve bugün seyire çıkan bir çok eser harem dairesinde tutuluyordu. Harem çok pahalı olduğu için de görmemişim. Bugün haremi de gördüm kutsal emanetleri de. Harem kısmı tadilatta olduğu için pek görülecek bir yanı yoktu. Zamana ait kıyafetler takılar silahlar hepsi muhteşemdi. Dekor edilmiş saray hali dönemi canlandırmada oldukça başarılıydı. Sarayı gezerken düşündüğüm tek şey kışın ne kadar soğuk olabileceğiydi, sonuçta herşey taş. Daha sonra yapılan Dolmabahçe sarayı kadar şaşalı ve gösterişli değil ama yapı olarak çok daha hoşuma gitti. Müze kartınız varsa dışarıya sırada beklemeden giriş yapabilirsiniz. İçeride harem için ayrıca bilet alınmalı.

L'antica residenza dei sultani ottomani è una delle attrazioni da vedere assolutamente a istanbul. La nostra visita è durata circa 4 ore perciò se decidete di andarci organizzatevi bene la giornata perché almeno mezza sarà destinata alla visita del palazzo. Avrebbe meritato anche 5 stelle ma ho tolto un voto perché a mio avviso il biglietto d'ingresso a più di 30 euro a persona è un po' troppo alto. In ogni caso nel biglietto è compresa l'audioguida in italiano e l'ingresso a tutte le attrazioni del complesso. Cmq secondo la mia esperienza è consigliato.
Ceddimden kalan şaheser, sergilenenden daha fazlası şu an kimbilir nerelerde
Greatly renovated. Harem was also great. Former St Irene church was completely empty - really not worthy to spend your money on it.
Beautiful setting.
Con Sergio .nostra guida!

Un lugar maravilloso en Estambul, lleno de magia e historia y símbolo del imperio Otomano en Constantinopla.  En él se encuentran trajes, armas, joyas, utensilios y tesoros originales.  Impresionante y bien conservada estructura, que en su tiempo fue sede del poder político del Sultán.
Ok
Es impresionante ver la majestuosidad de estas construcciones, son verdaderas obras de arte
Harika bir deneyimdi. Tek noksani harem kismi ekstra bir ucret isteniyor, gereksiz geldi. Tamamini gezmek istiyorsaniz genis bir zamanda gitmelisiniz cunku biz 2 saatte hala tamamini bitirememistik.

Allow several hours to walk through the palace and its grounds. There are many different portions to the palace, each with a different display related to the history of the building, the sultans, and the grounds. After the palace spend some time walking through the Gulhane Park next to the palace.
Schitterend! Bijna een dag doorgebracht.. wat een collectie en schitterende gebouwen!! Aanrader.

Go early in the morning or late in afternoon after the tourist buses and cruise ships are gone otherwise u won't see a thing as it's crazy busy...watch ur step too as the cobbled roads and paths are a bit precarious

Really big and interesting. Historic artifacts are in abundance. The prophets Mohammed s.a.w various belongings can be found here along with the companions. Can only recommend. Wait time isn't too long. Not too packed if you go during off season
Beautiful palace. Loads to see. Relics of the propher Mohammad are there. You will require at least a half day to visit. Plenty of toilets and cafes in site.
The gardens are very beautiful and the rooms are impressive,particularly those of the harem.
Excelente paseo ...para deleitarse con la experiencia
Sve preporuke.
Unbelieveable...
